quote.name: Onișoară Rafael Emre
paragraphs: Crystal Logistics Services is a private company created with the mission of becoming a pillar in the development and automation of processes in transport and logistics.

I started this business alone, aiming not only for profit but for a work environment built on values and a clear mission: delivering premium services at a fair cost and being a trustworthy consultant so clients receive exactly what they need.
Our vision: implementing systems and automations that allow us to remain competitive and raise the industry standards.

fleet.title: OUR FLEET & PARTNER NETWORK
paragraphs: Daily capacity: our own fleet & 4000+ verified partners. We operate with our own trucks and a large network of financially and operationally validated carriers.
This means daily availability, multiple trailer types (tautliner, fridge, mega, vans), GPS monitoring and standardized documents.
The result: premium quality, fair costs, on-time delivery.

We provide road transport for general goods, oversized cargo, ADR, refrigerated, tanker, or bulk shipments.

Includes loading, customs documentation, tracking, and optional insurance.

The fast and efficient solution for international cargo shipments.

Perfect for urgent or sensitive deliveries.

rail.title: Rail Transport

Combines road, sea, air, and rail transport for maximum efficiency and cost optimization.

Perfect for integrated logistics chains and strict delivery schedules.

cookies.title: Cookie Usage Policy

1.title: Introduction
content: This Cookie Usage Policy (hereinafter referred to as the 'Cookie Policy') is designed to inform you about our practices regarding the collection of information from you when you visit our website, through cookies and other tracking technologies, in full compliance with your right to personal data protection.
This policy is a complementary document to our Personal Data Protection Policy (GDPR), which we encourage you to read in order to fully understand how we process your data.

Our cookies do not store personal data that can directly identify you, such as your name or banking details. They allow us to collect information about your browsing activity, which can later be used to personalize your experience on the site or in our communications, in accordance with the law.

The confidentiality of information is an ongoing responsibility, and therefore we undertake to periodically update this document as we adopt new data protection practices or privacy policies. For processing based on consent, we will notify you of any changes and request your renewed consent if necessary.
The website https://www.crystal-logistics-services.com/ (hereinafter referred to as the 'Website') is operated jointly by:

• Crystal Logistics Services S.R.L., headquartered in Bucharest, Sector 1, Strada Dr. Iacob Felix, No. 49, Floor S, Room 9, Romania, registered with the Trade Registry under No. J40/4964/2021, Tax ID 43944517.
• Crystal Logistics Services GmbH, headquartered at Bahnhofstrasse No. 21, Zug, Switzerland, registration number CHE-217.611.963.
These entities use both first-party and third-party cookies to provide visitors with a superior browsing experience and services tailored to their needs and interests.

2.title: Legal Context
content: In accordance with the requirements of Directive (EU) 2002/58/EC ('E-Privacy Directive') and Regulation (EU) 2016/679 on the protection of individuals with regard to the processing of personal data and the free movement of such data ('GDPR'), we are obliged to manage, safely and only for the specified purposes, the personal data you provide through your use of our website.

The GDPR requires us to ensure transparency and user control, allowing you to express or withdraw consent for data processing, request correction or deletion of data, and be clearly informed about the purpose and nature of the cookies used.

3.title: Your Rights
content: As a data subject, you have several rights under the GDPR, including:
• The right to information and access to data
• The right to rectification
• The right to data erasure ('right to be forgotten')
• The right to restrict processing
• The right to data portability
• The right to object
For a detailed description of these rights and how to exercise them, please refer to the dedicated section in our Personal Data Protection Policy.
If you wish to exercise any of these rights, please contact our Data Protection Officer, as indicated in Section 4.
You also have the right to file a complaint with the National Authority for the Supervision of Personal Data Processing (ANSPDCP):
• Address: B-dul G-ral. Gheorghe Magheru No. 28-30, Sector 1, Postal Code 010336, Bucharest, Romania
• E-mail: anspdcp@dataprotection.ro

4.title: Data Protection Officer (DPO)
content: We have appointed a Data Protection Officer (DPO) to oversee all matters related to personal data protection. For any questions or concerns regarding the processing of your data, please send a written request, addressed to the Data Protection Officer.
• E-mail: acc@crystal-logistics-services.com
• Mailing address: Bucharest, Sector 1, Strada Dr. Iacob Felix, No. 49, Floor S, Room 9, Romania

5.title: Your Consent to the Use of Cookies
content: When you first access the Website, a banner will appear requesting your consent for the use of different categories of cookies. Until you accept or decline, no cookies, except those strictly necessary for the functioning of the Website, will be activated.

Your consent is granular, allowing you to select which categories of cookies you accept. You can modify your preferences or withdraw consent at any time through your browser settings or the dedicated link on the site.

6.title: What Is a 'Cookie'?
content: An 'Internet Cookie' (also known as a 'browser cookie' or simply a 'cookie') is a small text file consisting of letters and numbers stored on the computer, mobile device, or other equipment from which you access the Internet. A cookie is installed by a web server’s request to a browser (e.g., Chrome, Firefox, Edge) and is completely passive — it does not contain software, viruses, or spyware and cannot access data on your hard drive.

A cookie consists of two parts: the name and the value. The lifetime of a cookie is determined, and technically, only the web server that sent it can access it again when you revisit the corresponding site.
There are two main categories of cookies:
• Session cookies: These are temporarily stored in the browser’s cookie folder and are deleted automatically when the browser is closed or when you leave the site.

• Persistent cookies: These remain stored on your device’s hard drive for a predefined period and are reactivated when you return to the site. They can also be manually deleted by the user at any time.

7.title: How We Use Cookies on This Website
content: We classify our cookies into the following categories to help you understand their purpose:

• Strictly Necessary Cookies: These are essential for the proper functioning of the Website. They allow navigation between pages, session security, and access to restricted areas. Since the Website cannot function without them, these cookies are enabled by default and do not require your consent.

• Performance and Analytics Cookies: These help us understand how you interact with the Website by collecting aggregated and anonymous data. We analyze which pages are most visited, traffic sources, and any browsing errors. The information collected is used solely to improve the Website’s performance and structure. An example is Google Analytics.
• Functionality Cookies: These allow the Website to remember the options you’ve made (such as selected language) to provide a more personalized and efficient browsing experience.

• Marketing and Targeting (Advertising) Cookies: These are used to deliver advertising content relevant to your interests, based on pages you have visited. We may share this information with third parties (e.g., advertising agencies, platforms such as Google or Facebook) to display relevant ads on other websites and to measure campaign performance.

8.title: Types of Cookies We Use
content: Our Website may use the following types of cookies:
Cookie Name: cookieGDPR | Category: Strictly Necessary | Purpose: Stores your consent for cookie usage. | Duration: 1 year

Cookie Name: _ga, _gid | Category: Performance/Analytics | Purpose: Used by Google Analytics to distinguish users and generate anonymous statistical data on site usage. | Duration: _ga: 2 years, _gid: 24 hours
Cookie Name: _gat | Category: Performance/Analytics | Purpose: Used by Google Analytics to limit the rate of server requests. | Duration: 1 minute
Note: The list above is illustrative and may change. A complete and up-to-date list will always be available in the consent banner.

9.title: Third-Party Cookies
content: Certain content sections on our Website may be provided through third parties, such as videos from YouTube or maps from Google Maps. We also use traffic analytics services, such as Google Analytics, which place their own cookies.
These third parties may place cookies through our Website, and we do not control their privacy or cookie policies. We recommend reviewing the privacy policies of these providers:
• Google Analytics: Google Privacy Policy
• Google Maps: Google Maps/Google Earth Additional Terms of Service

10.title: How You Can Disable Cookies
content: Disabling or refusing cookies may make certain websites unusable or difficult to navigate. However, you have full control and can change your settings at any time.
Most modern browsers allow you to manage cookies through their settings. You can set your browser to reject all cookies or only third-party ones. You can also delete existing cookies.
Here are links to cookie management instructions for popular browsers:
• Google Chrome
• Mozilla Firefox
• Microsoft Edge
• Safari

11.title: Data and Cookie Security
content: Cookies are not viruses. They use plain text formats, do not contain executable code, and cannot self-run or replicate on networks.

Because they cannot perform these functions, cookies cannot be considered viruses. However, they may be misused for tracking or profiling, which is why browsers include privacy settings that allow different levels of cookie control and automatic deletion.

12.title: Changes to the Cookie Policy
content: We reserve the right to update this policy whenever necessary. Any modification will be published on this page and, if applicable, notified in the cookie banner during your next visit.

13.title: Questions and Contact
content: For any questions, concerns, or complaints regarding this policy or the way we use cookies, please contact us at acc@crystal-logistics-services.com.

1.title: Introduction
content: The privacy of your personal data is a fundamental priority for Crystal Logistics Services. This policy explains how we collect, use, transfer, and protect your personal data when you interact with us in connection with our products and services, including through our website.

This policy is prepared in accordance with Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data (known as 'GDPR'), as well as applicable national legislation.

2.title: Joint Data Controllers
content: In the context of providing our logistics and transport services, your data is processed jointly by the following entities, hereinafter referred to as 'Crystal Logistics Services', 'CLS', or 'the Company'.

rows: Bucharest, District 1, Strada Dr. Iacob Felix, No. 49, Floor S, Room 9, Romania

3.title: Data Protection Officer (DPO)
content: Given the legal obligations and complexity of our operations, Crystal Logistics Services has appointed a Data Protection Officer (DPO) to oversee GDPR compliance. For any questions, concerns, or to exercise your rights, please use the general contact details of the company, specifying that your request is for the attention of the DPO.
Contact details:
• Email: acc@crystal-logistics-services.com
• Mailing address: Bucharest, District 1, Strada Dr. Iacob Felix, No. 49, Floor S, Room 9, Romania

4.title: Categories of Personal Data Processed
content: Depending on the nature of your interaction with CLS, we collect different categories of personal data:
a) Clients and Business Partners (individuals or representatives of legal entities):
• Identification data: Name, surname, position.
• Contact data: Email address, phone number, correspondence/delivery address.
• Transactional data: Service details, order history, invoicing data (excluding card details), customs information.
• Data collected via the website: IP address, browser type, pages visited (see Cookies Policy for more details).
b) Individuals involved in shipments (senders, recipients):
• Identification and contact data: Name, surname, full address, phone number, email.
• Shipment details: Information about package contents (where personal data may apply), tracking data, customs information (including ID number, where legally required).
c) Employees and Candidates:
• Identification data: Name, surname, national ID number, ID card series and number.
• Contact data: Address, phone, email.
• Professional and education data: CV, employment history, diplomas, certifications.
• Financial data: Bank account, salary information.
• Medical data: Only as required by occupational health legislation.
d) Suppliers and Collaborators (individuals):
• Identification and contact data: Name, surname, address, phone, email.
• Financial data: Bank account, invoicing details.

5.title: Purposes and Legal Bases for Processing
content: Crystal Logistics Services processes your personal data for the following purposes, based on the legal grounds specified by the GDPR:

rows: Provision of logistics and transport services

Processing and managing transport orders.
Tracking shipments.
Managing warehousing and distribution operations.
Communicating with clients and recipients regarding delivery status.

Preparing and processing customs documents (including personal ID numbers where applicable).
Invoicing and financial accounting compliance.
Reporting to fiscal and other public authorities.

Collecting necessary data (name, contact, company details) to prepare and send a personalized offer.
Processing data to negotiate, conclude, and sign service contracts.

Administrative and operational communications.
Proactive contact with clients and partners.
Handling requests and complaints.
Evaluating client satisfaction.
Sending offers, newsletters, and information about CLS services.

Processing job applications and organizing interviews.
Concluding employment contracts.
Payroll and benefits management.

Monitoring facility access.
Ensuring network and IT system security.

Analyzing website traffic data to optimize user experience.
Internal reporting and efficiency analysis.

6.title: Recipients of Personal Data
content: To fulfill contractual and legal obligations, we may disclose your data to partners, subcontractors, authorities, service providers, and insurers, under confidentiality and data protection agreements.

7.title: International Data Transfers
content: Your data may be transferred outside the European Economic Area (EEA), particularly to Switzerland, where Crystal Logistics Services GmbH is based.
Transfers are carried out securely, based on the European Commission's adequacy decision or Standard Contractual Clauses (SCC).

8.title: Data Retention Period
content: Your personal data is stored only as long as necessary for the purposes for which it was collected:
• During the execution of the contract;
• 10 years for financial-accounting documents;
• Until withdrawal of consent (for marketing purposes);
• For the statutory limitation period necessary to defend our legitimate interests.

9.title: Your Rights
content: Under GDPR, you have the following rights:
• Right to information and access;
• Right to rectification;
• Right to erasure ('right to be forgotten');
• Right to restriction of processing;
• Right to data portability;
• Right to object;
• Right not to be subject to automated decision-making;
• Right to withdraw consent;
• Right to lodge a complaint with the National Authority for the Supervision of Personal Data Processing (ANSPDCP) - www.dataprotection.ro.

10.title: Personal Data Security
content: Crystal Logistics Services implements technical and organizational measures to ensure the protection of your personal data: encryption, access control, staff training, security audits, and incident management procedures.

11.title: Cookies Policy
content: Our website uses cookies to improve browsing experience, analyze traffic, and offer personalized functionalities. Please refer to the Cookies Policy for detailed information.

12.title: Changes to the Privacy Policy
content: We reserve the right to periodically update this policy. Any modifications will be published on our website and, where necessary, notified via the cookie banner.

13.title: Contact
content: For any questions or to exercise your rights, please contact us at:
Email: acc@crystal-logistics-services.com
Address: Bucharest, District 1, Strada Dr. Iacob Felix, No. 49, Floor S, Room 9, Romania

14.title: References
content: 1. Regulation (EU) 2016/679 (GDPR) - Official text of the regulation;
2. National Supervisory Authority for Personal Data Processing (ANSPDCP) - www.dataprotection.ro;
3. Guidelines and recommendations of the European Data Protection Board (EDPB);
4. Law No. 190/2018 on the implementation of GDPR;
5. Commission Implementing Decision (EU) 2021/914 on standard contractual clauses;
6. Commission Decision of 26 July 2000 on the adequacy of personal data protection in Switzerland.

sections.title: 1. Definitions
content: “General Terms and Conditions / GTC” – the set of contractual conditions applicable to all beneficiaries of transport services and related services, which supplement the provisions of the forwarding contracts and form an integral part thereof.

"Crystal Logistics Services S.R.L.", "CLS" or the "Forwarding Company": Crystal Logistics Services S.R.L., having its registered office in Bucharest, Sector 1, Dr. Iacob Felix Street, no. 49, Floor S, Room 9, having unique registration code: 43944517, and trade register number: J40/4964/19.03.2021, EUID: ROONRC.J40/4964/2021, phone: 0040.757.333.184, e-mail: acc@crystal-logistics-services.com, Crystal Logistics Services GmbH, having its registered office at Bahnhofstrasse Street, No. 21, Zug, Switzerland, registration number CHE-217.611.963, phone: 0040.757.333.184, e-mail: acc@crystal-logistics-services.com.

“Client” – legal entities/natural persons benefiting from the transport order or related services offered by CLS, regardless of whether they are the shipper, owner, consignor, final beneficiary of the transported goods. These GTC are applicable to all categories of persons mentioned above, even if the transport order is signed by one/some of them, and they are obliged to inform themselves regarding the transport of the goods.

“Forwarding Contract” is the contract by which the Client requests CLS to conclude, in its own name and on the Client’s behalf, one or more transport orders and/or ancillary services, by Crystal Logistics Services, for the Client, under the conditions mentioned in the contract and the GTC.

“Transport Order” or “Order” means any written request sent by e-mail, fax or electronic data interchange by which a certain transport order is assigned to CLS, based on a Forwarding Contract. A transport order concluded in the absence of a Forwarding Contract has the legal value of a Forwarding Contract. The Order shall be considered accepted after express approval, given in writing. The commencement of the Order’s performance by CLS in any manner shall be considered as a tacit confirmation.

sections.title: 2. The forwarding contract
content: 2.1. The object of the forwarding contract consists in the conclusion, in its own name and on the Client’s behalf, of one or more goods transport Orders and/or ancillary services, by Crystal Logistics Services, for the Client, under the conditions mentioned in the Forwarding Contract and the GTC.

2.2. The forwarding contract is a contract by which the Forwarding Company undertakes to conclude, in its own name and on the Client’s behalf, one or more transport contracts and/or to perform the ancillary operations.
2.3. The forwarding company that assumes the obligation to carry out the transport, with its own means or another’s, in whole or in part, has the rights and obligations of the carrier.
2.4. The forwarding contract provides clauses both regarding the transport itself and the ancillary services related to transport.

2.5. The forwarding contract (framework contract) enters into force on the date of its signing. Individual transport Orders enter into force from the date of acceptance without reservations of the offer and expire upon payment of the transport consideration. If within one hour from receiving the transport offer the Client does not announce an express refusal communicated in writing regarding the execution of the order, the transport order is considered validly concluded from the date the offer was sent.

2.6. Any modification of the order execution conditions without the written consent of the Forwarding Company shall not be taken into account. The Client shall immediately notify the Forwarding Company of any change in information that is relevant in any way for the correct execution of the goods forwarding. Otherwise, the Client shall bear all consequences of such an omission.

2.7. The Forwarding House undertakes to renegotiate the order in accordance with the modifications requested by the Client at most 48 hours before the loading date. After this deadline, the contract price can no longer be reduced, since 48 hours before the loading date the Forwarding House has already assumed payment of the transport cost for the transport capacity necessary to the Client towards its subcontractors.

2.8. Due to the general conditions on the transport market, the loading date and the unloading date are estimated, and these dates may change depending on the actual concrete situation encountered during transport, such as additional constraints or deviations of the means of transport on certain road segments, traffic blockages, stops at other loading/delivery points, unfavorable weather conditions, routine checks on the means of transport, etc., and the Client understands that these changes in loading/unloading dates do not represent the Forwarding Company’s fault.

2.9. During transport, the value of the goods is insured according to the insurance of the means of transport used. If the total value of the goods exceeds the insured value of the means of transport, the Client may request the Forwarding Company (i) to raise the liability limit of the means of transport insurance up to the value of the goods or (ii) to conclude cargo all risks insurance. Both ancillary services shall be negotiated by addendum and require payment of an additional fee.

2.10. Due to the general conditions on the transport market, in cases where the costs of providing transport increase (for example, due to road tolls, fuel costs, inflation on the transport market, etc.), the Forwarding Company shall notify the updated price at least 15 days before executing the next transport order, and the forwarding contract continues only after the Client accepts the new price; otherwise, it terminates by operation of law.

sections.title: 3. Obligations of the Forwarding Company
content: 3.1. The Forwarding Company shall use the necessary diligence for the organization and/or execution of the transport and the performance of ancillary services, according to the Client’s instructions, as agreed.
3.2. The Forwarding Company is obliged to take all measures necessary to protect the Client’s interests throughout the performance of the activities.

3.3. The Forwarding Company ensures that its subcontractors have a valid CMR insurance policy for the means of transport used. If the subcontractor’s CMR insurance does not take effect, the Forwarding Company benefits from a global CMR insurance policy, having a maximum insurance coverage in case of damages of EUR 2.5 million, within the limit of the CMR insurance value of the means of transport used.
3.4. In case of unjustified delay of the goods’ arrival at destination for more than 3 working days, the Forwarding Company shall compensate the Client with penalties of EUR 100 / working day.

3.5. The Forwarding Company must be organized and have the means necessary to perform its mission. The forwarding company assumes the obligation to promptly send transport offers upon the Client’s request with whom it has concluded a Forwarding Contract, whenever necessary.

3.6. Unless otherwise agreed, the Forwarding Company has the right to freely choose subcontractors, as well as transport modes and means used. The intermediary persons or subcontractors to which the Forwarding Company resorts for performing its obligations are considered accepted by the Client, if the latter has not expressed any opposition before the start of transport execution.

3.7. The Forwarding Company shall transmit transport documents (INVOICE, CMR, and optionally T1, CEMT, CARNET TIR, GOODS ACCOMPANYING NOTICES CONFIRMED AT UNLOADING, DELIVERY NOTES, WEIGHING NOTE, THERMODIAGRAM) exclusively through electronic means of communication, to the e-mail address provided by the Client.

3.8. The Forwarding Company’s obligation is limited to advising only on transport activity and/or ancillary services, without aspects related to the goods in relation to various authorities (import/export licenses, authorizations, dual use, etc.).
3.9. The Forwarding Company undertakes to verify that its subcontractors secure the goods in the means of transport properly so that they are not damaged during transport.

3.10. In the case of bulk goods transport, the generally accepted weighing error at unloading is 100 kg. If at unloading, based on the weighing ticket, a quantity difference greater than 100 kg is found, the Forwarding Company is obliged to request from the carrier compensations consisting of the price of the missing goods quantity above the 100 kg threshold, by reporting the quantity difference to the price of the transported goods in order to compensate the Client.
3.11. The Forwarding Company has the obligation to pay invoices within the deadlines established by contracts with its subcontractors.

sections.title: 4. Obligations of the Client
content: 4.1. The Client guarantees to the Forwarding Company, at the moment when the goods have been taken over by it, the accuracy of all details regarding the general nature of the goods, the marks, number, weight, volume and quantity and, if applicable, the dangerous character of the goods, as provided by the Client or on its behalf.

4.2. The Client is responsible for the way in which the documents it makes available to the Forwarding Company are prepared, their correctness and apparent legality, such as, but not limited to, commercial invoices, packing lists, etc. According to the updates in force of Emergency Ordinance no. 41/2022, if the transported goods fall into one of the categories of high fiscal risk goods (BRFR), the Client has the obligation to timely provide the UIT codes, to fulfill all legal obligations regarding the National RO e-Transport System, and shall be held liable towards the Forwarding Company and/or its subcontractors in case they are sanctioned due to failure to fulfill the reporting obligation.

4.3. The Client is obliged to send in writing to the Forwarding Company, at the latest at the moment of order confirmation, all details regarding order execution: type, weight, volume, value and packaging of the goods, details regarding the loading/unloading schedule, precise loading/unloading deadlines and other special conditions for goods transport. The instructions are subject to the Forwarding Company’s acceptance. However, they are considered accepted if, after their receipt by the Forwarding Company, execution has commenced. The burden of proof regarding special instructions given to the Forwarding Company rests with the Client.

4.4. The Client shall be liable to the Forwarding Company and shall indemnify it for all costs, expenses and official fees related to any damages, as a result of incorrect, incomplete or late information or instructions provided by the Client, or the delivery by the Client or any person acting on its behalf to the Forwarding Company or to any other person for whom the Forwarding Company may be liable, of goods that caused damage to property, means of transport and the environment or any other loss.

4.5. The Client must hand over the goods packed, marked and labeled so that they withstand transport and/or ancillary operations and can be delivered to the consignee according to the forwarding contract.

4.6. If at destination losses, damages or any harm to the goods are found, including those produced by transport delays when it was agreed that transport would be performed within a certain time limit, the consignee or those receiving the goods are obliged to ascertain the damages and fulfill the required formalities, including the formulation of legal reservations towards the carrier, as well as to take other measures ensuring the preservation of the right to claims and actions to recover damages, within the terms of international transport regulations. If the Client benefits from compensations granted through the Forwarding Company’s global CMR insurance, the Client shall be obliged to pay deductibles or other costs requested by the insurance company.

4.7. In case of refusal of the goods by the consignee or in case of its absence, regardless of the reason, the Client is obliged to bear the transport price, the ancillary services price, as well as the additional expenses incurred or undertaken by the Forwarding Company until transport completion, including additional services for the parking of the means of transport/storage until the goods are accepted by the consignee.

4.8. If the Forwarding Company engages customs operations on the Client’s behalf, the Client guarantees to the customs commissioner the payment of the customs debt and/or fines that may be due, determined by the provision of erroneous instructions or documents.

4.9. If the Forwarding Company, in unforeseen circumstances, acts in the Client’s interest to preserve the Client’s rights and the integrity of its goods, the additional costs and fees shall be borne by the Client.
4.10. The Client shall inform the Forwarding Company of any assignment of rights and obligations resulting from the forwarding contract to a third party.

4.11. If the Client cancels the order or withdraws from the contract before the start of transport execution, it shall compensate the Forwarding House with 30% of the transport value for means of transport between 3.5 and 40 tons and 50% of the transport value for oversized trailer / container chassis, representing organization costs, to which are added the expenses already undertaken by the Forwarding House for carrying out loading, unloading and transport (equipment rental, customs formalities, authorizations, parking, dispatch, etc.), without the total value of these costs being less than EUR 500.

4.12. The free time at the loading/unloading place is 4 hours for means of transport between 3.5 and 40 tons, and 2 hours for oversized trailer / container chassis. If the truck/means of transport parking time at the loading/unloading place exceeds this free time, the Client shall bear parking penalties of (i) EUR 50/hour of additional parking for means of transport between 3.5 and 40 tons or (ii) EUR 100/hour of additional parking for oversized trailer / container chassis until the end of the loading/unloading schedule. If loading/unloading is performed the next day, the penalties are (i) EUR 350/day of additional parking for means of transport between 3.5 and 40 tons or (ii) EUR 750/day of additional parking for oversized trailer / container chassis. The Client owes any additional costs/penalties issued by the Forwarding Company’s subcontractor caused by delays. Parking penalties may exceed the price of this contract.

4.13. The Client has the obligation to provide the UIT code (Unique Transport Identification Number) no later than on the day the goods are loaded, in order to comply with the legal regulations in force. If the transport is parked at border points due to the lack of the UIT code, additional fees for the parking period will be applied, costs to be borne by the Client. In the absence of providing the UIT code, the Client shall be responsible for paying the fines applied both to itself and to the carrier, according to the legislation in force. The carrier will not be able to perform deliveries on the territory of a destination country without holding the UIT code, this document being necessary for fulfilling customs formalities and carrying out international transport.

sections.title: 5. Customs clearance
content: 5.1. The Forwarding Company may provide in the forwarding contract the customs brokerage operations, if it holds the legal authorizations, or may engage a customs broker. For this activity, the Forwarding Company must comply with all applicable customs legislation requirements, agree in writing with the Client on the necessary guarantees and the submission of documents required by law.
5.2. For this activity, the Client owes the fees agreed between the parties, in addition to the fees provided in item 4.8.

sections.title: 6. Payment terms
content: 6.1. Payment for transport and other services shall be made by the Client based on the invoice issued by the Forwarding Company. The deadline for paying the invoiced amounts is the one provided for each transport order separately (before loading / before unloading the goods from the means of transport / on the date of transmitting the transport documents / within a fixed number of days from the transport date), but it may not exceed the maximum term of 30 calendar days.

6.2. If the agreed payment term is after loading or coincides with unloading (0 days from unloading), the Beneficiary is obliged to make full payment before starting the unloading operation from the means of transport. The truck will park for 30 minutes for collecting the transport consideration. The Forwarding Company has the right not to unload the goods and to charge a parking fee of EUR 50/hour until the full contract price is paid. Failure to pay on time the forwarding contract price and the parking of the means of transport at the unloading place / storage of the goods generates additional costs for the Client according to art. 8.3. below.

6.3. The Client is in contractual relations exclusively with the Forwarding Company, not with its subcontractors (such as carriers), therefore the forwarding contract price shall be considered paid only if it is paid into the Forwarding Company’s account. In exceptional cases where payment of the contract price is possible only in cash, the Client shall pay the transport price to the carrier exclusively with the written consent of the Forwarding Company. If the Client pays in cash to subcontractors without the Forwarding Company’s consent or without requesting a receipt at the time of payment, such payment shall not be taken into account and shall not be enforceable against the Forwarding Company.

6.4. Failure to pay on time the consideration for the service performed by the Forwarding Company entails delay penalties of 1% of the contract price for each day of delay, penalties calculated from the date the invoice is sent by CLS by e-mail, until the date of full payment. Delay penalties calculated from the due date until actual payment may exceed the amount of the debt owed.
6.5. If the negotiated price was in EUR, the invoice shall be issued both in EUR and in RON, at the NBR exchange rate from the day of issuance.

sections.title: 7. Successive forwarding contracts
content: 7.1. The forwarding contract has the effects of a framework contract in relation to each individual transport order, which is supplemented by the provisions of the forwarding contract and of the GTC.

7.2. During the forwarding contract, the Forwarding Company undertakes to honor each individual transport order sent by the Client in due time and to respect the price provided in the Forwarding Contract or, if the price is left to free quotation, to offer the most competitive prices possible for its Client. For this service, the Client may not request offers or conclude transport orders with other suppliers regarding the transports that are the object of this contract, except where the Forwarding Company fails, for exceptional reasons, to honor that order.

7.3. If the Client has been forced to conclude a single transport order that is the object of the contract with another similar service provider due to the Forwarding Company’s fault according to art. 7.2. above, the Forwarding Company undertakes to compensate the Client with the price difference actually paid by the Client to the third-party provider and the price the Forwarding Company would have offered according to the Forwarding Contract, within a limit of EUR 500.00.

7.4. The forwarding contract may be unilaterally terminated by sending a written notice to this effect by either Party. The forwarding contract may be rescinded for non-performance/improper performance by sending a written notice to this effect by the entitled party, the contract ending within 30 calendar days from sending the notice, except where, within this term, the party at fault performs/remedies the services. Termination/rescission/ending for any reason does not affect orders already performed or in the course of performance, and these shall be carried out according to the contract.

7.5. The Parties have a reciprocal obligation of loyalty regarding the execution of the forwarding contract, and they may not perform acts/facts that prejudice its proper execution. The Client may not initiate negotiations/conclude transport contracts directly with CLS subcontractors, under the sanction of the automatic termination of the forwarding contract and the payment of damages conventionally set at EUR 25,000, representing CLS’s unrealized benefit from all intermediation that could have been carried out according to this contract.

sections.title: 8. Pledge and right of retention
content: 8. Pledge right and right of retention

8.1. The Forwarding Company holds a legal right of pledge and retention over the goods and any documents related thereto, for any sum of money owed at any time to the Forwarding Company or its subcontractors (whom it represents in relation to the Client) resulting from transport services provided.

8.2. The right of retention ceases if the interested party deposits with the Forwarding Company the transport price and the consideration of all additional costs/penalties owed or offers the holder a sufficient guarantee. All costs arising in connection with exercising the right of retention/pledge, including but not limited to storage costs, handling, vehicle redirection, parking time, shall be borne by the Client, and the compensation for the incurred costs shall be paid before unloading the goods and presenting them to the consignee.

8.3. The right of retention until payment of the above costs is exercised after the free unloading time has elapsed or in the case of express refusal / lack of response regarding payment of the forwarding contract price, depending on the most feasible option, by (i) parking the means of transport at the loading/unloading place, the Client owing EUR 500/day of parking or (ii) storing the goods in a warehouse chosen by the Forwarding Company, the Client owing EUR 90 + VAT/ton/day of storage, including storage and handling costs of the goods, or (iii) any other reasonable method, including the sale or destruction of the goods.

8.4. CLS may, at any time, exercise its right of retention/pledge over goods and accompanying documents as a guarantee for payment of any other amount owed in accordance with the order, including recovery costs. This right of retention/pledge may be exercised not only for absence of payment related to the service in question, but may also be extended to any existing obligations at any time, including under other contracts. If the parties conclude several successive forwarding/transport contracts, they are considered as services forming part of a framework forwarding/transport contract with that specific Client, observing the contractual conditions agreed through the first forwarding/transport contract and supplemented by those negotiated by the parties through correspondence. CLS may invoke the rights in this section regarding any transport that is part of the forwarding/transport contracts concluded with this Client, until full payment of all transport services provided.

8.5. In the above hypothesis, CLS shall not be liable for delays in goods delivery or for any additional costs incurred for the consignee, which the latter has claimed or may claim from the Beneficiary, or for any other damage suffered by it.

sections.title: 9. Force Majeure
content: 9.1. The contracting Parties shall not be liable for non-performance on time and/or improper performance, in whole or in part, of any obligations incumbent upon them, if the non-performance of that obligation was caused by an unforeseeable event at the date of concluding the forwarding contract and whose consequences cannot be removed by the party invoking it.
9.2. The party invoking force majeure is obliged to notify the other party immediately and in full of its occurrence and to take all measures available to limit the consequences of that event.

9.3. Cases of force majeure exonerate the Forwarding Company, for their duration, from the obligations affected by these circumstances. In such cases, the Forwarding Company or the Client has the right to terminate the forwarding contract, even if it has been partially performed. If the Forwarding Company or the Client requests termination of the contract, the Forwarding Company is entitled to payment of all costs incurred for performance of the contract up to the termination date.
9.4. The party that invoked force majeure must prove it within a maximum of 5 days from the date it ends.

sections.title: 10. Disputes
content: 10.1. Any dispute with Crystal Logistics Services arising from the forwarding contract and which cannot be settled amicably shall be settled by the competent court at CLS’s registered office.

10.2. This clause is an alternative clause for establishing jurisdiction. If CLS files any court claim related to a Forwarding Contract/Transport Order in the Client’s jurisdiction, it is understood that CLS has waived the right to file such a claim before the competent courts corresponding to CLS’s registered office.

sections.title: 11. Final clauses
content: 11.1. The Client may not contact directly/indirectly the Forwarding House’s subcontractors without the latter’s consent. If the Client uses the know-how and logistics of the Forwarding Company to perform transport with the Forwarding Company’s subcontractor designated for this purpose, the Client shall remain obliged to pay the forwarding contract price to the Forwarding Company, as damages. The Forwarding Company shall not be held liable for transport services concluded under such conditions.

sections.title: 12. Processing of personal data
content: CLS, as a service provider, informs you that personal data processed within the company will be used exclusively for the purpose of executing the transport services contract, in compliance with Art. 6(1)(b) of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data. The processed data may include: first and last name, domicile/residence address, e-mail address, phone number, bank account number, Client code, invoice history, etc. CLS processes its Clients’ personal data in full compliance with legal provisions, and such data is not transmitted to third parties, only to subcontractors for the execution of the transport contract. In certain situations, personal data are or may be communicated to central/local public authorities and institutions (for example, the National Agency for Fiscal Administration, police bodies, prosecutor’s offices and courts). CLS will process your personal data throughout the duration of the contract concluded with you, as well as for 3 years after its termination (for the possibility of requests or other types of actions following the end of the contractual relationship). However, by virtue of its legal obligations, CLS will store and archive certain personal data of its Clients for longer periods, according to fiscal and accounting legislation. According to EU Regulation 679/2016, you have the following rights: to request access to processed personal data; to request rectification or deletion of data or restriction of processing, according to the law; to benefit from data portability; to file a complaint with the Supervisory Authority or to address courts of law.

1.title: 1. Definitions
content: "Crystal Logistics Services S.R.L.", "CLS" or "The Freight Forwarding Company": Crystal Logistics Services S.R.L., having its registered office in Bucharest, Sector 1, Strada Dr. Iacob Felix, no. 49, Floor S, Room 9, having the unique registration code: 43944517, and trade register number: J40/4964/19.03.2021, EUID: ROONRC.J40/4964/2021, phone: 0040.757.333.184, e-mail: , Crystal Logistics Services GmbH, having its registered office at Strada Bahnhofstrasse, No. 21, Zug, Switzerland, registration number CHE-217.611.963, phone: 0040.757.333.184, e-mail: .
"Carrier": The legal entity that provides freight transport services based on an Order or a Transport Contract with CLS.

"Transport Contract" or "Order": The agreement between CLS and the Carrier, materialized through a written order (e-mail, fax, etc.) or a framework contract, by which the Carrier undertakes to provide freight transport services under the agreed conditions.
"Parties": Means CLS and the Carrier together.
"Final Customer": The beneficiary of the transport, the shipper or the consignee of the goods, who has a contractual relationship with CLS.

"POD" (Proof of Delivery): The set of documents that certifies the performance of the transport, including but not limited to: original signed CMR, invoice, T1, CEMT, delivery notes, weight slips, temperature printout etc.

2.title: 2. Conclusion and Scope of the Contract
content: 2.1. Scope of the Contract: The scope of the contract is the provision of freight transport services by the Carrier for CLS, in accordance with the details specified in each Order.

2.2. Entry into Force: The Contract is deemed concluded and enters into force in any of the following situations, whichever occurs first:
   a) On the date it is signed by both Parties.
   b) On the date of the Carrier’s unconditional acceptance of the offer/order communicated by CLS.
   c) In the absence of an express refusal from the Carrier within one hour from receiving the Order.
   d) By the start of the trip by the Carrier (arrival at the loading place).

3.title: 3. Price and Payment Terms
content: 3.1. Price: The price of the transport service is the one explicitly mentioned in each Order agreed by the Parties. The price is firm and cannot be changed unilaterally.

3.2. Price Renegotiation: A renegotiation of the price may only take place at the explicit request of CLS, in due time before the loading date, if it is necessary to reduce or increase the quantity of goods.
3.3. Payment Terms: Payment shall be made according to the payment term (due date) specified in the Order.

3.4. Submission of Documents (POD):
   a) The Carrier is obliged to send the complete set of documents (POD) to the correspondence address of CLS and in electronic format to acc@crystal-logistics-services.com, within 15 days from the delivery date.
   b) Penalty for delay: If the original documents are not received within 15 days, the due date of the invoice is automatically extended by 45 days, without the need for prior notice.
   c) Non-conformities: If the documents are illegible, incomplete, incorrect or present any other non-conformity, the payment term shall be calculated from the date on which CLS receives the correct and complete original documents.
   d) Electronic-only documents: Receiving documents exclusively in electronic format is accepted only if this option is explicitly mentioned in the Order.

3.5. Tax Invoice:
   a) The invoice shall be issued with the date of unloading of the goods.
   b) The invoice must necessarily include the CLS order number and the value both in RON and in EUR.
   c) Illegible or incorrect invoices, or invoices that do not contain the required information, will be rejected for payment, and the due date will be recalculated from the date of receipt of the corrected invoice.
3.6. Cash Payments: Cash payment is not accepted, except where there is a prior written agreement from CLS.

4.title: 4. General Transport Conditions
content: 4.1. Technical Condition of the Vehicle: The Carrier guarantees that the vehicle used is in proper technical condition, clean, dry, without foreign smells and has the required loading capacity, including a reserve of 3.5 tons for handling equipment (forklift). CLS does not assume any liability for the technical condition of the vehicle.

4.2. Inspection of Goods at Loading: The driver is obliged to check and ensure the integrity, quantity and apparent condition of the goods in accordance with the transport documents. Any discrepancy (damage, shortages) must be recorded on the CMR and reported immediately to CLS before leaving the loading place. Loading shall not continue without the express consent of CLS.

4.3. Loading, Securing and Handling: The driver is responsible for supervising correct loading, stowage, weight distribution on axles and proper securing (lashing) of the cargo inside the vehicle in order to prevent any damage during transport. The Carrier assumes full responsibility for the integrity of the goods until final delivery.

4.4. Supervision and Security of the Cargo:
   a) Supervision: The driver is obliged to ensure the guarding and safety of the cargo throughout the transport, including by not leaving the vehicle unattended.
   b) Secured Parking: Loaded vehicles must be parked only in secure parking areas (fenced, illuminated, with video surveillance and access control). The route must be planned so that rest periods are taken in such parking areas.
   c) Anti-theft Devices: In the absence of secure parking, at least two independent anti-theft devices (mechanical or electronic) must be installed and activated. The standard door lock and ignition key are not considered anti-theft devices.

4.5. Free Loading/Unloading Time: The free time granted for loading and unloading operations is 48 working hours. Any additional waiting time must be communicated immediately to CLS and recorded on the CMR. For exceeding this period, the Carrier is entitled to compensation of 100 EUR per working day.

4.6. Types of Transport:
   a) FTL (Full Truck Load): Loading of any goods other than those specified in the Order is strictly prohibited. Breach of this clause entails the full liability of the Carrier, who will be obliged to pay the full value of the transport service and all damages caused.
   b) LTL (Less than Truck Load): The Carrier shall ensure that the goods loaded together are compatible so as to prevent any contamination or mutual damage (e.g. ADR, foodstuffs, waste).

4.7. Temperature-controlled Transport (Reefer):
   a) The temperature must be checked at loading and maintained constantly throughout the transport, according to the specifications in the Order.
   b) The temperature printout is mandatory at unloading and must be sent together with the rest of the POD documents. Failure to comply with this requirement will lead to non-payment of the transport.

4.8. Bulk Cargo Transport: The maximum permissible weighing error at unloading is 60 kg. For any shortage exceeding this limit, the Carrier shall compensate CLS both with the value of the missing goods and with a reduction of the transport price proportional to the undelivered quantity.

4.9. Dangerous Goods Transport (ADR): The Carrier guarantees that it holds all necessary authorisations, equipment and certificates (including the driver’s ADR training certificate) to perform the transport in full compliance with the ADR Convention.

4.10. Suspect/Defective Goods: In the case of damaged or suspect goods (including in transports affected by stowaways/migrants), unloading is prohibited without the prior written consent of CLS. The Carrier shall follow CLS’s instructions regarding the return, inspection or destruction of the goods, all related costs being borne by the Carrier.

4.11. Romanian RO e-Transport System: For goods with high fiscal risk (BRFR), the Carrier is obliged to ensure the transfer of vehicle positioning data and to obtain the UIT code before entering Romanian territory. The Carrier is fully liable for any fines or financial consequences (including confiscation of the goods) resulting from failure to comply with this obligation.

4.12. Extra-EU Transports: The Carrier is obliged to present itself at the customs offices indicated by CLS for completion of formalities. Failure to do so entails a fixed penalty of 500 EUR payable to CLS, in addition to any other damages caused.

4.13. Changes in Circumstances: The contract price remains unchanged regardless of the quantity actually loaded. If a higher quantity is found at loading, the driver must inform CLS and must not load additional goods without written consent. Breach of this rule leads to maintaining the same price for the extra quantity and reducing the price for any missing quantity.
4.14. Transhipment of Goods: Transhipment is strictly prohibited without the prior written consent of CLS. Breach of this rule entails a penalty of 1,000 EUR, plus the value of any resulting damages.

5.title: 5. Obligations of the Parties
content:
5.1. Obligations of the Carrier:
   a) Communication: To provide CLS with information about the truck’s position whenever requested and to maintain constant contact (phone, e-mail) with the CLS dispatcher throughout the trip.
   b) Compliance with Instructions: Not to leave the loading/unloading address without written instructions from CLS.
   c) Safekeeping of Documents: To keep all documents (customs, commercial) safe and to present them only to authorised persons.
   d) Personal Protective Equipment (PPE): To ensure that the driver has and uses proper PPE and complies with internal regulations at the loading/unloading sites.
5.2. Obligations of the Freight Forwarding Company (CLS):
   a) Provision of Information: To provide the Carrier with all necessary information and documents for the proper execution of the transport.
   b) Payment for Services: To pay the price of the transport services according to the terms agreed in the Order.
   c) Payment of Waiting Time: To pay compensation for waiting time, in case the free time of 48 hours is exceeded, in accordance with art. 4.5.

6.title: 6. Cargo Insurance
content: 6.1. CMR Insurance: The Carrier guarantees that it holds a valid CMR insurance policy with minimum coverage of 50,000 EUR per event.

6.2. Coverage of Damages: Any damage caused to the goods during transport shall be covered by the Carrier’s CMR insurance. If the insurance does not fully cover the damage (for any reason, including deductible or exclusions), the Carrier shall bear the difference directly, as compensation. CLS cannot be held liable for covering such damages.

7.title: 7. Improper Performance and Penalties
content: 7.1. Non-performance or Cancellation of the Order by the Carrier: Cancellation of the order after its acceptance or failure to present at loading entails a penalty of 30% of the contract value, but not less than 500 EUR.

7.2. Cancellation of the Order by CLS: In case of order cancellation after the truck has travelled to the loading place, CLS will cover travel costs at 0.5 EUR/km, up to a maximum of 200 km. The Carrier must provide clear proof of the travelled distance.

7.3. Delay at the Loading/Unloading Place:
   a) Hour-based delay: If an exact time is specified, the Carrier shall owe penalties of 50 EUR per hour of delay.
   b) Day-based delay: If the delay exceeds 24 hours, CLS may cancel the order and apply the 30% penalty (according to art. 7.1). If CLS does not cancel the order, the Carrier shall owe penalties of 350 EUR/day (for trucks 3.5–40t) or 750 EUR/day (for oversized trailers).

7.4. Partial Transport or Reduced Distance: If the Carrier loads less cargo or travels a shorter distance than agreed, without CLS’s prior written consent, the contract price will be automatically reduced pro-rata.
7.5. Lack of Communication: Failure to comply with the obligation to maintain contact with CLS (art. 5.1.a) is penalised with a fixed amount of 500 EUR.

7.6. Set-off: CLS has the right to set off any outstanding amounts owed by the Carrier (penalties, damages) directly against unpaid transport invoices. If the debts exceed the value of the invoices, CLS will suspend payments until full settlement of the debts.

8.title: 8. Final Provisions
content: 8.1. Pledge and Retention Right: The Carrier acts as an agent of CLS in exercising the right of pledge and retention over the goods if CLS’s Final Customer does not pay the transport price. The Carrier is obliged to strictly follow CLS’s instructions regarding parking of the truck or unloading the goods in a warehouse indicated by CLS. Unloading the goods without CLS’s written consent, in situations where such consent is required, entails a penalty of 100% of the transport cost, the Carrier being directly liable for the damages caused by releasing the goods.

8.2. Force Majeure: Neither Party shall be liable for failure to fulfil its contractual obligations if such failure is due to a force majeure event, unforeseeable and unavoidable. The Party invoking force majeure must notify the other Party as soon as possible.

8.3. Confidentiality and Prohibition to Contact Customers:
   a) Confidentiality: The Carrier undertakes to treat as strictly confidential all commercial information of which it becomes aware (prices, customers, routes, etc.) and not to disclose it to third parties.
   b) Prohibition to Contact the Final Customer: It is strictly forbidden to contact directly or indirectly CLS’s Final Customer, as well as to enter into any direct agreement with them. Breach of this clause is penalised with a fixed amount of 50,000 EUR, as liquidated damages.
   c) Unfair Competition: If, following the breach of this clause, the Carrier starts working directly with CLS’s Final Customer, the Carrier shall additionally owe penalties of 25% of the value of all transports performed with that customer.

8.4. Assignment and Subcontracting: Assignment or subcontracting of transport services is strictly prohibited without the prior written consent of CLS. Breach of this obligation entails a fixed penalty of 2,000 EUR per case, without prejudice to CLS’s right to claim additional damages.

8.5. Additional Penalty Clauses:
   a) Defamation and Threats: Any insults, threats or defamatory statements made against CLS (including online) may lead to penalties for moral damages of up to 50,000 EUR.
   b) Blackmail: Conditioning the delivery of the goods on an advance payment not agreed contractually is deemed blackmail and is penalised with 10,000 EUR.
8.6. Governing Law and Disputes: This contract is governed by Romanian law. Any dispute that cannot be settled amicably shall be submitted to the competent courts of Bucharest.

9.title: 9. Personal Data Protection (GDPR)
content: CLS processes the Carrier’s personal data (name, contact details, identification data, etc.) for the purpose of performing the transport contract, in accordance with Regulation (EU) 2016/679 (GDPR). The data may be disclosed to parties involved in the performance of the contract (customers, warehouses, customs authorities) or to public authorities upon request. The data is stored for the duration of the contractual relationship and for a period of 3 years after its termination, except for documents for which tax and accounting legislation requires a longer retention period. The Carrier benefits from the rights of access, rectification, erasure, restriction of processing and data portability, as well as the right to lodge a complaint with the Supervisory Authority.

Accordion.title: Freight Transport Legislation
Accordion.intro: Under what conditions is freight transport carried out?

class1.title: Public Road Freight Transport
class1.short: may be carried out by transport operators only if certain conditions are met, including holding the required documents:
listItems: a certified copy of the transport license (ARR license and ARR certified copies);
a transport document, allowing you to justify the transport to the State Inspectorate for Road Transport Control;
a certificate proving that the vehicle meets pollution and road safety standards;
an international transport authorization (for international transport only).

class2.title: Romanian road transport operators may carry out international public road freight transport:
listItems: only based on international transport authorizations issued by the competent authority;
in compliance with international agreements or conventions to which Romania is a party.

class3.title: Documents required for own-account road transport:
listItems: a certified copy of the own-account transport certificate (ARR certified copies);
documents proving that the goods are transported on own account.

sectionOne.title: DO YOU NEED REFRIGERATED FREIGHT TRANSPORT?
sectionOne.p1: We provide high-quality refrigerated transport services, with a fleet equipped to ensure optimal conditions for transporting chilled or frozen goods.
sectionOne.p2: Crystal Logistics Services offers customized and efficient solutions tailored to the specific needs of your business.

sectionTwo.title: What types of goods do we transport?
sectionTwo.p1: At Crystal Logistics Services, we handle a wide range of goods, continuously adapting to the requirements and needs of our clients.
sectionTwo.p2: We provide international refrigerated transport solutions for various types of products:
listItems: frozen goods (fish, meat, vegetables, semi-prepared foods, etc.): −18/−20°C. The set temperature is monitored and kept constant throughout the entire journey;
chilled products (vegetables, fruits, fresh meat, flowers, etc.): 0°C/+6°C.

highlight.title: WHY WORK WITH US FOR REFRIGERATED TRANSPORT?
highlight.description: Our experience and the technology we use allow us to maintain full control of the cold chain from loading to delivery, ensuring your goods arrive in perfect condition.

card1.title: Adaptable vehicles
card1.description: Our fleet includes everything from refrigerated sprinters to large-tonnage trucks for long-distance routes, all equipped with modern temperature-control systems ranging from −20°C to +25°C.

card2.title: Temperature certification
card2.description: We monitor and record temperature variations throughout the entire transport, enabling you to prove compliance with storage requirements.

card3.title: Flexibility and adaptability
card3.description: We can transport products requiring different temperatures simultaneously using compartmentalization and flexible loading solutions, without compromising quality or safety.

card1.title: Isothermal transport vehicles
card1.short: For short distances and low-perishability goods.
descriptions: Vehicles with thermally insulated walls and no built-in cooling unit, ideal for short-distance transport of goods with reduced perishability.
Maintain a stable internal temperature for a limited period of time.

card2.title: TANKERS
card2.short: For food-grade liquids at controlled temperatures.
descriptions: Specialized tankers for food-grade liquids (e.g., milk, juices), with insulation and systems that maintain pre-set temperatures.
Allow easy cleaning and sanitization to meet food-safety standards.

card3.title: REFRIGERATED TRANSPORT VEHICLES
card3.short: For products requiring very low temperatures.
descriptions: Vehicles equipped with controlled-temperature cooling units, suitable for frozen or ultra-chilled products.
Maintain the set climate throughout the entire journey, including international transport.

Header.title: ADR TRANSPORT
Header.alt: Banner Transport Marfă Rutier - Crystal Logistics Services

section_1.title: CHOOSE THE SAFE ROUTE – ADR DANGEROUS GOODS TRANSPORT
section_1.p1: Transporting ADR dangerous goods represents a major challenge.
section_1.p2: At Crystal Logistics Services, we specialize in handling these transports, ensuring that your goods are managed and delivered under maximum safety conditions.
section_1.p3: Our team consists of qualified specialists, continuously trained in accordance with ADR regulations.

sectionTwo.title: OUR EXPERIENCE
sectionTwo.p1: We have extensive experience managing oversized transports for projects in multiple industries, from renewable energy and infrastructure to industrial equipment and complex metal structures.
sectionTwo.p2: We offer international refrigerated transport solutions for a variety of products:

Packaging.title: PACKAGING OF DANGEROUS GOODS AND LABELING OF PACKAGES
introParagraphs: Dangerous substances are classified and grouped according to ADR based on their level of hazard. This classification helps us understand the specific packaging requirements for each type of cargo and choose the correct solutions to protect both the load and the environment.
Packages must be designed to withstand transport conditions and prevent leaks or damage. ADR packaging instructions specify the required performance level for each type of packaging.
outroParagraphs: Packages undergo rigorous testing to verify that they meet ADR requirements, including visible marks and labels that quickly indicate hazard type and handling instructions.

Safety.title: SAFETY – OUR NUMBER ONE PRIORITY
introParagraphs: In the field of dangerous goods transport, safety is not just a priority — it is essential. Failure to comply with regulations can lead to serious consequences, from fines and operational delays to major incidents.

Our drivers are regularly trained and tested to ensure they can handle dangerous goods safely and efficiently. Trucks are inspected and certified to guarantee they are properly equipped for the type of cargo being transported.
Additionally, you can benefit from the services of a specialized safety advisor who ensures full compliance with legal requirements and provides support in planning and documenting ADR transports.

highlight.title: CHOOSE THE IDEAL TRANSPORT SOLUTION FOR DANGEROUS GOODS
highlight.description: Every ADR project is different. That’s why we offer flexible solutions that cover both groupage (LTL) and full truckload (FTL) transport, depending on the volume and type of cargo.

card1.title: GROUPAGE TRANSPORT (LTL)
card1.description: Ideal for smaller quantities of ADR dangerous goods. Combining multiple loads in one truck makes the transport efficient and cost-effective, while maintaining safety standards.

card2.title: EXCLUSIVE TRANSPORT (FTL)
card2.description: The ideal solution for large quantities or high-risk goods. The entire truck is dedicated to a single shipment, offering maximum control over the route and delivery time.

card1.title: CURTAIN-SIDER TRUCKS
card1.short: A versatile solution for palletized dangerous goods.
descriptions: Curtain-sider trucks are ideal for transporting ADR dangerous goods packed in boxes or on pallets.
They provide protection from weather conditions and allow easy loading and unloading.

card2.title: BOX TRUCKS
descriptions: With a rigid and robust structure, box trucks are designed to protect sensitive and dangerous goods.
They ensure increased safety and better handling control.

card3.title: TANKERS
card3.short: For dangerous liquids, gases, and powders.
descriptions: ADR tankers are equipped for the safe transport of dangerous liquids, gases, and powders.
They include specific equipment and valves compliant with current ADR standards.

Accordion.title: ADR DANGEROUS GOODS CLASSES
Accordion.intro: Dangerous goods are classified into 9 main classes based on the type of risk they present. Correctly identifying the ADR class is essential for choosing the right packaging, vehicle, and safety measures.

class1.title: Class 1: Explosive materials and objects
class1.short: Substances and objects capable of producing explosions through chemical reaction.

class2.title: Class 2: Gases
paragraphs: Subclass 2.1: Flammable gases
Subclass 2.2: Non-flammable, non-toxic gases
Subclass 2.3: Toxic gases

class3.title: Class 3: Flammable liquids
class3.short: Liquids with a low flash point that can ignite easily.

class4.title: Class 4: Flammable solids; substances liable to spontaneous combustion; substances emitting flammable gases when in contact with water
paragraphs: Subclass 4.1: Flammable solids
Subclass 4.2: Substances liable to spontaneous combustion
Subclass 4.3: Substances emitting flammable gases on contact with water

class5.title: Class 5: Oxidizing substances and organic peroxides
class5.short: Substances that may promote combustion or violent reactions.
paragraphs: Subclass 5.1: Oxidizing substances
Subclass 5.2: Organic peroxides

class6.title: Class 6: Toxic and infectious substances
class6.short: Substances that may cause poisoning or serious illness.
paragraphs: Subclass 6.1: Toxic substances
Subclass 6.2: Infectious substances

class7.title: Class 7: Radioactive materials
class7.short: Materials that emit radiation and require strict protection.
listItems: Examples: uranium, plutonium, radioactive isotopes used in medicine.

class8.title: Class 8: Corrosive substances
class8.short: Substances that damage living tissue or materials.
listItems: Examples: sulfuric acid, hydrochloric acid, caustic soda.

class9.title: Class 9: Miscellaneous dangerous substances and articles
class9.short: Various substances or items that present risks.
listItems: Examples: asbestos, lithium-ion batteries, environmentally hazardous substances.

cta.p1: For more details or a personalized ADR transport quote, please contact us.

Accordion.title: What you need to know about bulk freight transport
Accordion.intro: Road transport of bulk goods such as grains, sawdust, coal, or certain food products requires special attention from logisticians and freight forwarding companies for both domestic and international transport operations.

class1.title: Specific cargo information and risk anticipation
paragraphs: These are essential for optimal route and equipment planning, reducing empty runs and allowing rapid reaction to unforeseen events.

class2.title: Transport complexity
paragraphs: This stems from the diversity of goods, strict transport conditions, required specialized infrastructure, dedicated logistics procedures, and additional resources involved.

class3.title: Promptness and safety
paragraphs: These are essential for clients, especially when dealing with sensitive goods. Freight intermediaries often provide complex services that include both transport and full logistics management.

class4.title: Type of vehicle used
paragraphs: It must match the type of cargo being transported and comply with legal requirements. Thorough cleaning is essential to avoid contamination.

class5.title: Transport of food products
paragraphs: This is regulated at the European level, specifying transport conditions and vehicle requirements.

class6.title: Complete cleaning, disinfection, and drying
paragraphs: Cleaning, disinfecting, and fully drying vehicles are mandatory after each transport, in accordance with the client’s requirements.
